main event: Three unidentified objects were observed in Bellevue Hill, Vermont on April 29, 1952, during a local observation.
interesting points: The objects were bluish in color and circular in shape,The sighting lasted for approximately 2-3 minutes,The objects appeared and reappeared 20 degrees to the right and left of their course,Clear weather conditions (CAVU) were reported at the time of the sighting,Initial assessment suggested the objects might be balloons or aircraft but stated there was insufficient data.
witness description: Not specified; details derived from official reports
